SEint Eadmund þe confessour &punctelev; þat l&ydot;thþ at pountene&ydot;e Pounteneye
Of guode men and trewe he cam &punctelev; þei hu&ydot; neren nouȝht ful heiȝe
In Engelonde he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; in þe toun of Abindone
Glad miȝhtte þe moder beo &punctelev; þat bar swuch a sone
Mabile þe riche is moder [het] &punctelev; þat guod womman was inouȝ
Fo&rrot; boþe wif and[MS. and and] w&ydot;dewe &punctelev; to holie lif heo d&rrot;ouȝ
Lu&slong;tniez nouþe and i ma&ydot; telle &punctelev; hou and in ȝwat manere
Seint Eadmund was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; ȝif ȝe it wollez ihere[vv. 78 al. om.]
Aseint Eadmundus dai þe king &punctelev; þis guode child was ibo&rrot;e
So clene he cam fram is moder &punctelev; withoute echmanere ho&rrot;e
And so clene[al. d&rrot;ie] þat no cloth &punctelev; þat neiȝh þe moder was
Ne neiȝh þis ȝoungue child þo it was[þowas al. om.] ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; noþing þe foulere[al. isoilled] it nas
¶Aseint Eadmundes dai he was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; riȝht ase it was da&ydot;
Fram erne mo&rrot;ewe þat[al. fo&rrot;te] it was eue &punctelev; ase a ded þing he la&ydot;ȝ
Riȝht ase he were dedbo&rrot;e &punctelev; fo&rrot; no þing on him lif ne saiȝ
Þe midew&ydot;ues him wolden habbe ibured &punctelev; ac þe moder seide euere na&ydot;
Aȝein eue he cudde fur&slong;t is lif &punctelev; to churche he was ibo&rrot;e
And fo&rrot; seint Eadmundes da&ydot; &punctelev; he [was] Eadmund icleoped þarefo&rrot;e
¶Þis child wax and wel iþev &punctelev; elles wonder it were
Þo it was of ani elde &punctelev; þe moder it sette to lere
And Robert also hire oþur sone &punctelev; fo&rrot; sones heo hadde to
And twe&ydot;e ma&ydot;denes clene inouȝ &punctelev; hire douȝhtren were also
Dame Margerie and dame Alis &punctelev; þat at catesbi Catesbi weren ido
And þare in religion Nonnes nonnes hu&ydot; weren &punctelev; and ȝu&ydot;t liggez þare boþeto
¶Dame Mabile heo&rrot;e guode moder &punctelev; þeos child&rrot;en heo louede inouȝh
And wissede heom to clene liue &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse heom d&rrot;ouȝh
Þe ȝw&ydot;le þe child&rrot;en ȝongue weren &punctelev; heo ȝaf heom ofte mede
Fo&rrot;to fa&slong;te þane frida&ydot; Friday &punctelev; to watur and to b&rrot;ede
Þo&rrot;uȝ mede and þo&rrot;uȝ ire faire bihe&slong;te &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren so þaron ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat þo hu&ydot; weren of gretto&rrot;e elde &punctelev; it ne grefde heom riȝht nouȝht
¶Þe moder werede þe &slong;trongue here &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerdes loue
Fram þe schold&rrot;e to þe hele &punctelev; and on haubark þareaboue
In swuche manere he ladde hire lif &punctelev; þe widewe þat was so wis
wel ȝongue heo sende boþe hire sones &punctelev; to scole to paris Paris
And bitok heom spense lu&ydot;te inouȝ &punctelev; ase heo it miȝhte biseo
hu&ydot; senden hire wo&rrot;d þat hu&ydot; ne miȝhten &punctelev; with so lu&ydot;te beo
leoue sones quath þe mode[r] &punctelev; ichulle beon aȝein eov hende
Ȝif ȝe wollez aftur me do &punctelev; ich can eou mo&rrot;e sende
And it schal eov like swiþe wel &punctelev; bi þat ȝe w&ydot;teth þe ende
Ne spariez nouȝht mi leoue sones &punctelev; out of londe to wende
¶Leoue Moder moder queþen þe sones &punctelev; we schullen do aftur þi lo&rrot;e
63 · 180
Ake wel þou wo&slong;t þat we ne mouwen nouȝt libbe &punctelev; bote þou us sende mo&rrot;e
¶Þe moder tok wel &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; e&ydot;þur of heom ane here
And bad heom boþe fo&rrot; hire loue &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; with heom as bere
And werie as twie oþur þrie &punctelev; eche woke þere
And heo wolde heom sende spense inov &punctelev; þe ȝwu&ydot;le hu&ydot; at scole were
¶Þis child&rrot;en ȝeoden to scole þo &punctelev; and duden heo&rrot;e moder he&slong;te
And wereden þe here twie a wike &punctelev; oþur þrie at þe le&slong;te
So longe hu&ydot; woneden heom þarto &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; nomen as ofture þo
So þat noþur n&ydot;ȝht ne da&ydot; &punctelev; hu&ydot; nolden heom fo&rrot;go
¶hu&ydot; woneden heom so wel þarto &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; as wereden da&ydot; and n&ydot;ȝht
Þis was fo&rrot;soþe a guod Moder moder &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo teiȝhte hire child&rrot;en ariȝht
And euere ȝwane heo sende heom cloþes &punctelev; ase heo as miȝhte iwinne
Þarewith heo wolde herene sende &punctelev; fa&slong;te iseuwede withinne
¶Seint Eadmund þe ȝongue clerk &punctelev; to eche guodnesse d&rrot;ouȝ
Þat euerech clerk þat him iknevȝ &punctelev; hadde of him Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerdes swete grace &punctelev; with him was wel riue
And þat o&rrot;e louerd cudde him wel &punctelev; al bi is ȝongue liue
¶Fo&rrot; ase þis child ȝeode a da&ydot; &punctelev; in a Mede to pleie
his felawes he bilefde echon &punctelev; and ȝeode biside þe weiȝe·
¶And al one ȝeode up
and doun &punctelev; and is bede&slong; &slong;eide·
Þo cam þere gon a fair ȝwit child &punctelev; to him in þis mede
Felawe he seide heil þou beo &punctelev; þat þus one ge&slong;t ilome
Seint Eadmund &slong;tod in gret þouȝht &punctelev; fro ȝwannes þis child come
¶Ne knou&slong;tþou me nouȝht quath þis child &punctelev; seint Eadmund seide no
Ich am þi felawe quath þat child &punctelev; ȝwodere þou euere go
At scole ich sitte euere bi þe &punctelev; euere on þi riȝht side
And with þe ich go in euerech &slong;tude &punctelev; ne go þou no so wide
¶And þi pleifere fo&rrot;soþe ich am &punctelev; and ȝif þou no&slong;t nouȝt ȝwat ich beo
¶In mi fo&rrot;eheued iwrite &punctelev; mi name þou miȝht iseo.[Ashm. has 4 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
And also ase mi name is &punctelev; in mi fo&rrot;eheued ido
Creo&ydot;ce þarewith þi fo&rrot;eheued &punctelev; and þi b&rrot;eo&slong;te al&slong;o·
¶ Eu&combtildevert;eche euereche niȝhte are þou &slong;lepe
in þe mu&ydot;nde of me·
¶And þe deuel ne schal habbe no pouwer &punctelev; fo&rrot;to greui þe
¶Seint eadmund nu&slong;te mit þusse wo&rrot;de &punctelev; ȝware þis child bicam
he onder&slong;tod þat it was o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; and gret Io&ydot;e ioye to him he nam
And nolde furȝite neuere ane niȝht &punctelev; his lo&rrot;e fo&rrot;to do
to creoici þriȝes is fo&rrot;eheued &punctelev; and is b&rrot;eo&slong;te also
¶And segge ihesus of Nazareth &punctelev; ase he it saiȝ iwrite
with noþing ne scholde a man betere &punctelev; fram[al. wiþ] þe deuel him wite
In penaunce and in is lo&rrot;e &punctelev; þis child dude al is þouȝt
Fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue he þolede muche &punctelev; þat deo&rrot;e him hadde abouȝht
¶In penaunce he was so wel iwoned &punctelev; and ȝong þaron ib&rrot;ouȝht
Þat þo he was of gretto&rrot;e elde &punctelev; it ne grefde him riȝht nouȝht
At par&ydot;s Parys he was at scole longue &punctelev; and at Oxenfo&rrot;d also
he ne dude neuere lecherie &punctelev; ne ensentede þarto
Ase is schriftfader wolde telle &punctelev; ofte in p&rrot;iueite
he ne miȝhte neuere finde man &punctelev; of so gret cha&slong;tete
· 63 ·
¶Priueliche at oxenfo&rrot;d Oxenford &punctelev; on a da&ydot; he cam
To one &ydot;mage of o&rrot;e lauedi &punctelev; and bi þe hond hire nam
And bihiet bifo&rrot;e hire treweliche &punctelev; fram eche wummanes imone
And with treuþe holden al is lif &punctelev; clanliche to hire one
¶Þulke &ydot;mage he weddede with a ring &punctelev; ase a man dotþ is wif
Clanliche to holden in spoushod &punctelev; to hire al is lijf
Aue Maria gracia plena &punctelev; þeos four wo&rrot;des weren ido
And igraued in þis ring &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; aco&rrot;deden wel þarto
¶Wel he huld is treuþe setþe &punctelev; and his weddingue also
And trewe spouse was inovȝ &punctelev; nolde he nouȝt misdo
Ich wot wel ȝu&ydot;t men miȝhten finde &punctelev; hoso souȝte bliue
Summan þei it sielde beo &punctelev; untreowo&rrot;e to is wiue
And al ful beo of þe Mariage mariage &punctelev; ȝe and fa&ydot;n it wolde unbinde
Ȝweþur ani of eou couþe ouȝwere &punctelev; ani swuch hosebonde finde
¶His ho&slong;tasse hadde one douȝter &punctelev; þere he was at inne
Þat louede muche þis holie child &punctelev; ȝif heo miȝhte is loue iwinne
heo ne couþe neiȝh non oþur wit &punctelev; ake heo fondede fo&rrot;to do
Folie bi him n&ydot;ȝht and dai &punctelev; ȝif heo miȝhte b&rrot;ingue him þarto
¶Heo bad him þat heo mo&slong;te aniȝht &punctelev; to is bedde wiende
Þis holie clerk ne wernde hire nouȝht &punctelev; and dude ase þe hende
Þat Maide maide was þo glad inovȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot; ero&rrot;e heo bad wel of[te]
Aniȝht þo heo hire t&ydot;me isaiȝh &punctelev; to is bed heo cam wel softe
¶hire cloþes heo dude of a non &punctelev; ase it is riȝht of bedde
And made hire naked to creopen in &punctelev; ake febleliche hire spedde
Fo&rrot; seint Eadmund hadde ane smarte ȝeo&rrot;de &punctelev; and þe cloþus adoun sp&rrot;adde[al. þis womman anon he redde]
And beot hire on þe nakede rug &punctelev; þat welneiȝh heo awedde
he ne sparede rug ne side noþur &punctelev; are heo to grounde bledde
Aquenche he miȝhte hire fole wille &punctelev; mid blode þat heo schedde
¶And euere seide þis holie Man man &punctelev; ase he leide on fa&slong;te
Maide þou schalt leo&rrot;ni þus &punctelev; awei fo&rrot;to ca&slong;te
Þi fole wille of þi flesch &punctelev; with swuche discipline
heo þouȝhte wel lu&ydot;te on folie &punctelev; are þis guode clerk wolde fine
¶Þis Maide maide wende softe aȝen &punctelev; hire rug smert ful so&rrot;e
he[heo.] biȝat so lu&ydot;te þo &punctelev; þat hire ne longuede þudere nammo&rrot;e
Clene wumman heo bicam &punctelev; withoute flechsliche dede
And clene Maide maide deide setþe &punctelev; ase hire schriftfader seide
¶Þis Maidenes maidenes þat beotþ willeffole &punctelev; folie fo&rrot;to do
Icholde hu&ydot; founden swuche lefmanes &punctelev; þat wolden heom cha&slong;tie so
Þo Mabile is swete moder &punctelev; scholde of þis liue go
Seint Eadmund hire guode sone &punctelev; neiȝh hire was þo
his Moder moder him ȝaf hire blessingue &punctelev; þo heo scholde of liue fare
Blesse mine b&rrot;oþur quath seint Eadmund &punctelev; þei he beo ellesȝware
¶Leoue sone quath þis w&ydot;dewe &punctelev; boþe ȝe comen of me
And he is ȝwane ȝe beoth o blod &punctelev; iblessed inouȝ with þe"þe" added later, though possibly in the same hand.
Ake ich bidde þe fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; and fo&rrot; seinte Marie
· 63 · Edward 63 181
Þat þou sumȝware þine so&slong;trene do &punctelev; into ane nonnerie
So þat hu&ydot; mouwen clene lif lede &punctelev; in o&rrot;e louerdes seruise
And ne soffre þou nouȝht þat hu&ydot; beon &punctelev; iweddet in none wise
Þe catel þat ich heom biqueþe &punctelev; þis dede fo&rrot;to do
Al ich bitake in þine warde &punctelev; and heom þarewith also
¶Þis guode womman deide þus &punctelev; þat of w&ydot;dewene was flour
And in a chapel at Abindone heo was ibured &punctelev; with sw&ydot;þe gret honour
In a &slong;ton bifo&rrot;e þe croiz &punctelev; in þe soutþside iwis
A lu&ydot;te withinne þe churchehei ȝate &punctelev; þat chapel arerd is
Aboue hire is iwrite &punctelev; here lijthþ in þis &slong;ton
Mabile flour of wudewene &punctelev; and lesingue nis it non
Fo&rrot; heo was womman of guode liue &punctelev; ase Men men miȝhten bi hire iseo
And mani Miracle miracle at Abindone &punctelev; fo&rrot; hire hath sethþe ibeo
¶Ne fo&rrot;ȝat nouȝht seint Eadmund &punctelev; þat is moder him hadde ibede
Þo is power was iwoxe &punctelev; he purueide him ane &slong;tude
Þat is so&slong;tren weren ido &punctelev; in one Nonnerie nonnerie
Ake wel vnneþe he it fond &punctelev; withoute s&ydot;monie
¶Simonie so is icleoped &punctelev; fo&rrot;eward fo&rrot;to make
to bugge liflode of holie churche &punctelev; and a certein catel take
Amansede beotþ alle swuche &punctelev; þat so wollez don
Ake naþeles to religion &punctelev; manie comiez so
¶Þis guode sone souȝhte wide aboute &punctelev; mani a Nonnerie
Are he miȝhte his so&slong;tren do &punctelev; withoute s&ydot;monie
Atþe la&slong;te he cam to Catesbi &punctelev; in No&rrot;ehamptoneschire
Igraunted him was þare anon &punctelev; al þat he wolde desire
¶boþe his su&slong;tren a gode&slong; Godes half &punctelev; Nounnes nounnes he made þere
Þat leueden þare al heo&rrot;e lijf &punctelev; and holie wommen were
Þe eldo&rrot;e was sethþe p&rrot;io&rrot;esse &punctelev; of þe lauedies echon
Fo&rrot; heom hauez setþe o&rrot;e louerd ido &punctelev; miracles mani on
And bifo&rrot;e þe heiȝe weuede &punctelev; iburede hu&ydot; beoth þere
In a chapele þat hu&ydot; leten &punctelev; of seint Eadmund arere
¶Seint Eadmund þis holie man &punctelev; werede &slong;trongue here
In &slong;trengo&rrot;e manere heo was imaud &punctelev; þane oþur mannes were
heo nas isponne ne iweoue &punctelev; ake ib&rrot;oide &slong;trengus longue
And sethþe ase man knut a net &punctelev; iknut swiþe harde and &slong;tronge
Of harde ho&rrot;ses here imaud &punctelev; þe knottes deope wode
Þat muche del of is bodie o&rrot;n &punctelev; of quiture and of blode
¶Þareof he hadde schuirte and b&rrot;iech &punctelev; fram necke to þe hiele
vna&ydot;seliche he miȝhte ligge &punctelev; oþur ani[al. & lutel] a&ydot;se ifele
A &slong;trong rop þere was þanne &punctelev; aboue fram þe schold&rrot;e ido
to is bottokes of ho&rrot;sehere &punctelev; to holden it fa&slong;te to
And setþe he was bineoþe is b&rrot;iech &punctelev; igurd fa&slong;te inovȝ
with a &slong;trong co&rrot;de aboue &punctelev; þat þe here fa&slong;te d&rrot;ouȝ
¶So fa&slong;te was in euerech side &punctelev; þe here to him ibounde
Þat vnneþ[e] he miȝhte bieȝe is rug &punctelev; oþur &slong;toupi touward þe grounde
63
And ȝwan he &slong;toupede aniþing &punctelev; is flechs was so fo&rrot;gnawe
Þat wonder was hou he it þolede &punctelev; þat he ne hadde to deþe id&rrot;awe
¶Fiet and hondene þat neren nouȝt &punctelev; ito&rrot;mentede with þat here
Necke and face and al is heued &punctelev; þat withoute were
he roddede aniȝht with þe here &punctelev; ȝwane no man ne miȝhte i[r. it] seo
Fo&rrot; he nolde þat no lime &punctelev; unpined scholde beo
¶A dai he tok al p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; is Manne his olde here
Þat he as furb&rrot;ende &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; fo&rrot;olde were
he ca&slong;te as in gret fu&ydot;r inovȝ &punctelev; ac it ne cam nouȝht þareneiȝh
Ake euere hu&ydot; weren iliche sounde &punctelev; ase þis man iseiȝh
Þo he isaiȝ þat hu&ydot; ne b&rrot;ende nouȝht &punctelev; he bond þerto wel fa&slong;te
heuie &slong;tones to d&rrot;awe adoun &punctelev; and into a deop watur heom ca&slong;te
Þat fu&ydot;r nadde power non &punctelev; to touchi þe holie here
Ake naþeles he tolde is louerd fo&rrot;e &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ib&rrot;ende were
¶Seint Eadmund and is felawe &punctelev; ase it was ofte heo&rrot;e wone
In a da&ydot; fram leukeno&rrot;e Leukenore &punctelev; wenden to Abindone
Ase hu&ydot; comen in a gret ualeiȝe &punctelev; blake foule hu&ydot; seiȝe
Ase it crowene and rokes weren &punctelev; fleon bi þe E&ydot;r wel heiȝe
A lu&ydot;te blac sak ase þei it were &punctelev; þis foules among heom bere
hu&ydot; ca&slong;ten it up fram on to oþur &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; it altod&rrot;owe and totere
his felawe &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; and was neiȝh wod fo&rrot; fere
¶Seint Eadmund him ȝaf confo&rrot;t &punctelev; ant tolde him ȝwat it were
Deuelene he seide of helle it beoth &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; berez so iwis
Ane Mannes mannes soule herebifo&rrot;e &punctelev; of Chalgraue it is
Þat nouþe riȝht deide late &punctelev; heo ne cometh neuere in blis
he mai singue we&ydot;lawei &punctelev; þat he euere dude amis
¶Fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; wenden to chalgraue &punctelev; þe soþe hu&ydot; founden þere
Þe Man man was ded a lu&ydot;te bifo&rrot;e &punctelev; and al hot ligge on bere
Neuere þe gladdo&rrot;e ne miȝhte he beo &punctelev; þat deuelene him so totere
he miȝhte segge weilawe&ydot; &punctelev; þat euere is lifdawes were
¶Seint Eadmund þe holie Man man &punctelev; louede wel is lo&rrot;e
And fo&rrot; is lo&rrot;e he louede ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; gode&slong; Godes seruise ⁁þe
⁁ mo&rrot;e
Me&slong;t he louede on o&rrot;esoun &punctelev; þat was of ihesu cri&slong;t Crist
And of o&rrot;e leuedi is swete Moder moder &punctelev; and of sein Ioan þe Ewangeli&slong;t
Þat .O. intemerata &punctelev; bigv&ydot;nnez on lat&ydot;n
Þe bigu&ydot;nningue is wel guod &punctelev; and also is þe fin
Euereche dai bi cu&slong;tome &punctelev; he seide þis o&rrot;esun
he nolde bileue fo&rrot; no scole &punctelev; ne fo&rrot; no lessoun
¶In a dai he it furȝat &punctelev; he hadde so muche to done
Seint Ioan þe Ewangeli&slong;t to him cam &punctelev; þe niȝht afturward ful sone
And a paumerie bar on is hond &punctelev; gret and &slong;trong inouȝh
Seint Eadmund he nam bi þe hond &punctelev; and is paumerie op d&rrot;ouȝh
So heiȝe and with so gret E&ydot;r &punctelev; ase he him wolde altod&rrot;iue
Seint Eadmund la&ydot; and quakede &punctelev; and d&rrot;ad was of is liue
Fo&rrot; ȝif he him smite ase he dunt d&rrot;ouȝ &punctelev; he were ded anon
He quakede & cride dulfulliche &punctelev; louerd merci Zeint Iohn
¶ Ich wole forȝeue þe quaþ Seint Iohan &punctelev; þu criest so sore
& þench bet on oure oreisoun &punctelev; & neforȝet hit nomore
He neforȝat after þulke tyme &punctelev; nomore þis oreisoun
For no studie nefor no neode &punctelev; nefor þoȝt of lessoun
¶ So wel lurnede þis holi man &punctelev; & suche grace hadde
Þat he bigan at Oxenford &punctelev; & of art þer radde
Of art he radde six ȝer &punctelev; contynuelliche ynouȝ
& siþþe forto beo more profound &punctelev; to arsmetrike he drouȝ
& arsmetrike radde in cours &punctelev; in Oxenford wel faste
& his figurs drouȝ aldai &punctelev; & his numbre caste
¶ Arsmetrike is alore &punctelev; þat of figurs al is
& of drauȝtes as me draweþ in poudre &punctelev; & of numbre iwis
¶ A niȝt in avisioun &punctelev; his moder to him wende
Sone heo seide to what figurs &punctelev; woltou nou entende
Leoue moder quaþ þis oþer &punctelev; suche as we iseoþ
Leoue sone quaþ þe moder &punctelev; betere figurs þer beoþ
Wherto þu most þin hurte do &punctelev; & þenche heron nomore
Heo nom forþ his riȝt hond &punctelev; & wrot þeron his lore
Þreo rounde cerclen heo wrot &punctelev; in þe paume amidde
In þe tueye heo wrot fader & sone &punctelev; & holigost in þe þridde
Sone heo seide herafterward &punctelev; entende to þis lore
To heuene aȝe þe moder wende &punctelev; heneseȝ hire nomore
¶ Þo iseȝ seint Edmund &punctelev; þat hit was al of þe Trinite
& þat God wolde þat he schulde &punctelev; ihure diuinite
To diuinite as God wolde &punctelev; þis gode man him drouȝ
Þer nespedde non in Oxenford &punctelev; so wel of ynouȝ
Hit nas noȝt longe þerafterward &punctelev; þat þe Chanceler ne sede
& þe hexte maystres of þe toun &punctelev; þat he schulde bigynne & rede
He wiþsede & longe seide &punctelev; þat he nas noȝt worþi þerto
So þat moche aȝen his wille &punctelev; nede hi makede him hit do
So þat he bigan at Oxenford &punctelev; of diuinite
So noble alosed þer nas non &punctelev; in al þe vniuersite
Of redinge he hadde so gode grace &punctelev; þat meni on to him drouȝ
His scolers þat ihurde of him &punctelev; gode men were ynouȝ
So pitousliche he wolde rede &punctelev; & so gode grace hadde þerto
Þat his scolers þat ihurde of him &punctelev; nuste ofte what to do
Ac sete as in anoþer wordle &punctelev; & ofte hudde here eȝe
& wepe þat þe teres vrne adoun &punctelev; þat men hit alaboute iseȝe
vneþe eni ihurde of him &punctelev; þat þe betere ne bicom
& meni bileuede al þe wordle &punctelev; & to religioun nom
¶ A dai as þis holi man &punctelev; in diuinite
Desputede as hit was his wone &punctelev; of þe Trinite
In his chaire he sat longe &punctelev; er his scolers come
A lutel he bigan to swoudri &punctelev; as a slep him nome
Þo þoȝte him in his swoudringe &punctelev; þat a whit coluere com
Fram heuene mid oure louerdes flesch &punctelev; & þe wei to him nom
& þat swete flesch pulte in his mouþ &punctelev; & siþþe fleȝ vp anheȝ
Heuene openede hire aȝen &punctelev; as þis gode man iseȝ
Þe sauour of oure louerdes flesch &punctelev; him þoȝte was in his mouþe
And al þe clergie him þoȝte of God &punctelev; þo he awok he couþe
Of þe pure stat of Crist &punctelev; & of his mageste
As an angel him þoȝte he couþe &punctelev; & of his priueite
¶ He bigan so deope desputi &punctelev; of þe Trinite
Þat gret wonder me hadde &punctelev; þurf al þe vniuersite
Þat þe gretteste clerkes þat were &punctelev; in Oxenforde þo
Ne þoȝte þat eni vrþlich man &punctelev; so furforþ miȝte go
Ne wite so moche of Godes stat &punctelev; bote hit an angel were
Þer nere none maystres in Oxenford &punctelev; þat in gret wonder þerof nere
Ac he miȝte of Ihesu Crist iwite &punctelev; more þan was in boc
Whan he vsede oure louerdes flesch &punctelev; & in his mouþe toc
¶ Ne þoȝte noȝt þis holi man &punctelev; so moche in his lessoun
Þat euere among his þoȝt nas mest &punctelev; in Godes passioun
O tyme he was in grete studie &punctelev; of his lessoun anyȝt
Þat longe he sat þeraboute &punctelev; forte hit was neȝ dailiȝt
Þo hit was toward þe dai &punctelev; anapped he was sore
He lynede adoun vpon his boc &punctelev; þo he nemiȝte studie nomore
So þat he ful aslepe &punctelev; & vnywar also
& ne þoȝte noȝt on þe passioun &punctelev; as he was iwoned to do
Þe deuel com to him wel sone &punctelev; noþing to siche he nas
Seint Edmund of him was iwar &punctelev; in swoudring as he was
He wolde him blesci wiþ þe deuel &punctelev; his riȝt hond he gan forþ drawe
Þe deuel him nom þerbi anon &punctelev; he nemiȝte him noȝt wawe
Þo nom he forþ his lift hond &punctelev; to blesci him wiþ also
Þe deuel him nom þerbi faste &punctelev; þat he nemiȝte noþing do
Vpe him he lai as a sak &punctelev; þat he was al ouercome
He nemiȝte him wawe fot ne hond &punctelev; his poer him was binome
Ac delyure he hadde al his þoȝt &punctelev; so þat he þoȝte sone
Of oure louerdes passioun &punctelev; as he was woned to done
¶ Þe deuel nemiȝte þo bileue &punctelev; vpe him none þrowe
For drede he ful sone adoun &punctelev; bituene him & þe wowe
¶ Seint Edmund aros vp anon &punctelev; & þe deuel ouercom
Strangliche & harde ynou &punctelev; bi þe þrote he him nom
Þurf oure louerdes passioun &punctelev; tel nou he seide me
Ich axi þe hou cristene man &punctelev; mai best him witie fram þe
Me ne schal wiþ noþing quaþ þe deuel &punctelev; schulde fram mi poer
So wel as þurf his passioun &punctelev; þat þu nemnedest er
¶ Þer lurnede þis holi man &punctelev; as we mowe ek echon
In whiche manere we mowe best &punctelev; þe deueles poer forgon
For he hatieþ Godes passioun &punctelev; as man doþ his fon
